title: [Extension Proposal]  Quarkus Gradle UI

labels.name: area/quarkiverse
labels.description: This issue/PR is part of the Quarkiverse organization

body:
### Description

Interested in this extension, please +1 via the emoji/reaction feature of GitHub (top right).

I am opening this to initiate the discussion around piloting build tools from the web UI.

I have a POC working with gradle that allow to list all project tasks and execute them:

https://github.com/rmanibus/quarkus-gradle-ui

Here are a couple of features I can see fit for this extension: 

- executing tasks from the UI
- view dependencies versions
- upgrade dependencies (update interactive style)

Some open questions:

- Currently it is hard to get info about the current build (no clear way to get the project directory for instance), what would it take to expose something like core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/dev/DevModeContext.java ?
- Could this be built in a tool agnostic way (working for both maven and gradle) ?
